","correct":"1","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":"Learning elements of a second language follows a predictable order","A1":"Language learning develops through drills and repetition","A2":"Language is learned when the input is comprehensible","A3":"Language development occurs in an anxiety-free environment","Q":"The Natural Approach, developed by Stephen Krashen and Tracy Terrell, emphasizes that people "acquire" language best by learning naturally like children do. This approach is based on a set of principles. Which of the following is NOT a principle of this approach? ","correct":"2","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":"Conflict of interest","A1":"Confidentiality ","A2":"Equity","A3":"Segregation","Q":"Jamal is a high school teacher. He often has behavior problems with his students. He has recently reached a compromise with them: "Students who do not make noise will get extra marks on their test." The teacher's decision raises the issue of","correct":"3","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":"Rote learning","A1":"Peer support","A2":"Scaffolding","A3":"Conservation","Q":"While teaching writing to beginners, Mrs. Benaissa provides close assistance ot the students by helping them with ideas and outlining their writing. She also closely monitors their work and gives them feedback on their writing as recquired. As learners show they have improved their writing skills, the teacher provides them with less support while she allows them to work with peers. What the teacher is doing can be labeled as: ","correct":"3","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":"Nejma made very good use of ICT in her lessons because she asked learners to work in pairs","A1":"Nejma didn't use ICT appropriately because she used it only in the practice stage of the lesson","A2":"Nejma shouldn't have used ICT in that lesson because we can teach the simple past without ICT ","A3":"Nejma used ICT in an appropriate way because she only projected what's already in the textbook","Q":"In one of her lessons, Nejma decided to use ICT  to teach the simple past tense. She took pictures of some practice exercises from the textbook and projected them to learners.Students worked on the exercises in pairs and the teacher provided them with the correction later.  Which of the following would be the most appropriate judgement to form about Nejma's use of ICT in the lesson? ","correct":"4","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":""By the end of the lesson, students will be able to recognize the past perfect"","A1":""By the end of the lesson, students will be able to understand the past perfect"","A2":""By the end of the lesson, students will be able to appreciate the past perfect","A3":""By the end of the lesson, students will be able to use the past perfect"","Q":"For his performance-based lesson, Rachid asked his colleague Leila for feedback on his grammar lesson plan. One of her comments is that the objective of the lesson (By the end of the lesson, students will know the past perfect) is problematic. Which of the following reformulations can be used to improve the lesson objective? ","correct":"4","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":"Biological processes","A1":"Cognitive processes","A2":"Emotional processes","A3":"Psychomotor processes","Q":"During her life, a child goes through different maturational satges. Each stage is characterized by changes which affect various processes. Some of the processes involve changes in the child's thinking and the way they perceive the world around them. This involves the ability to use their reasoing, the ability to memorize things, the ability to think in an abstract way and the ability to think creatively and to solve complex problems. These maturantional changes might be labeled as","correct":"2","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":" It can be used to display learners' grades on the writing task","A1":"It can be used before students start their writing to help them with ideas","A2":"It can be used after writing; when the teacher is giving feedback on students' products","A3":"It can be used to share the outline with the whole class","Q":"Abdelali is a high school teacher. He is an ICT enthusiast. He has his own computer and video-projector. In one of his 2nd Year Baccalaureate classes, he is planning to use this equipment in a writing lesson. Which of the following is NOT an appropriate use of Abdelali's equipment to teach wriring? ","correct":"1","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":"She didn't understand the task","A1":"The teacher didn't practice regular verbs enough","A2":"There is a problem with the task set by the teacher","A3":"She hasn't yet mastered regular verbs","Q":"After teaching the past form of regular verbs, Rachid checked student's understanding by asking them to wirte answers to the following questions: "Wher did you go last weekend? What did you do?" Maria, one of the students, answered: " I waked up early and goed to the mall with my friends." Why do you think Maria answered in this way?","correct":"3","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":"Making lists of students who do their homework and those who come to class on time","A1":"Preparing lists of students' partial grades and averages for the administration","A2":"Preparing end of term tests and additional practice exercises for learners","A3":"Providing learners with more updated materials  (such as photos) than those in the textbook","Q":"For which of the following practices can Microsoft PowerPoint be used in a language class?","correct":"4","explanation":"","referTo":""},{"A0":"Application and creation","A1":"Analysis and evaluation","A2":"Remembering  and understanding","A3":"Analysis and creation","Q":"After silently reading a text in which different experts express their opinions about illegal immigration, learners were asked to underline all the statements which express different views about the issues in the text. They are then asked to work in pairs and sort out the different views into those who are with and those who are against immigration and their arguments. Finally, the teacher asked learners to react to the arguments of each person and to say which one is more convincing and why. Which of the following pair of levels in Bloom's taxonomy of cognitive objectives is the teacher targeting in her activities in the lesson? ","correct":"2","explanation":"","referTo":""}];
